definitions.definition: One who does something habitually, such as a serial criminal offender.
(grammar) A construction representing something done habitually.
Of or relating to a habit; established as a habit; performed over and over again; recurrent, recurring.
definitions.example: Her habitual lying was the reason for my mistrust.
Professor Franklein took his habitual seat at the conference table.

definitions.definition: Of a person or thing: engaging in some behaviour as a habit or regularly.
(grammar) Pertaining to an action performed customarily, ordinarily, or usually.
